title: Augusta: John P. Lightner to Kate Armentrout, February 16, 1861
summary: Lightner apologizes to Kate for not writing her more often; he then continues to discuss family, friends, and local social events. He mentions the formation of a "Union Prayer meeting" in Lexington as well as other cities and towns. It is not clear if this is a prayer meeting for the benefit of the United States government or one that involves several different religious denominations.
keywords: Arts/Leisure, Church/Religious Activity, Family, Women, American Civil War
